intro: Chamaerhodiola wulingensis, commonly known as the Wuling sandwort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens.
